title: PrimeK-Net: Multi-scale Spectral Learning via Group Prime-Kernel Convolutional Neural Networks for Single Channel Speech Enhancement
author: Zizhen Lin (Sichuan University), Junyu Wang (Tianjin University), Ruili Li (Tohoku University), Fei Shen (Nanjing University of Science and Technology), Xi Xuan (City University of Hong Kong), ...
relevance_why: The use of convolutional neural networks and attention mechanisms in speech enhancement can improve models like VoiceFixer, thereby benefiting Haohe Liu's research in speech restoration.
background: Enhancing speech quality from noisy signals, especially in conditions where speech may be degraded by environmental noise or recording imperfections.
contribution: PrimeK-Net introduces a Group Prime-Kernel Feedforward Channel Attention module to improve the performance of single-channel speech enhancement, achieving a state-of-the-art PESQ score of 3.61 with only 1.41 million parameters.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models like Conformer and Dilated Dense Blocks struggle with computational efficiency and neglect multi-scale spectral characteristics.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes prime number properties to avoid periodic overlap effects and integrates a Deep Separable Dilated Dense Block, significantly reducing computational complexity.

key_innovation: Integrates group prime-kernel convolutions and efficient channel attention mechanisms to capture multi-scale features effectively.
real_world_impact: Improves speech enhancement technology for real-time applications, potentially enhancing user experiences in communication systems and voice-activated devices.
limitations: The paper does not highlight significant limitations aside from possible performance compromises when employing the new methods.

new_terms.Group Prime-Kernel: **Group Prime-Kernel** refers to a convolutional kernel design utilizing prime numbers, aimed at enhancing spectral learning while minimizing periodic responses during feature extraction.
new_terms.Deep Separable Dilated Dense Block: **Deep Separable Dilated Dense Block** is a modified convolutional block that splits convolutions into depthwise operations and point-wise operations, significantly improving computational efficiency.
